definition: to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased

sentences.english: When brain death occurs, who's going to notice?
sentences.chinese: 當腦死亡的時候，誰會注意？

sentences.english: The implementation of the law of brain death will pr…
sentences.chinese: 實施腦死亡法必將大大促進我國肝臟移植水平的提高。

sentences.english: China is one of the minority countries which have not passed through the law ot brain death in the world.
sentences.chinese: 目前我國是世界上尚未通過腦死亡法的少數國家之一。

sentences.english: She was declared brain-dead, and my wife and I donated her organs.
sentences.chinese: 她被宣佈腦死亡後，我和妻子把她的器官捐了出去。

sentences.english: The doctor told us that Hugh was essentially brain dead.
sentences.chinese: 醫生告訴我們，休實際上已經腦死亡了。

sentences.english: She promptly collapsed and was later declared brain-dead.
sentences.chinese: 然後一下子倒在地上，隨後她被宣佈爲腦死亡。

sentences.english: Some people think football is a matter of life and death.
sentences.chinese: 任何連看三場足球賽的人都可以宣佈腦死亡。

sentences.english: The islets were isolated from the pancreas of brain-dead donors.
sentences.chinese: 用於移植的胰島細胞取自腦死亡供體的胰腺。

definition: unable to turn around a hopeless situation (idiom)/to fail to save the situation

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
medical doctor/physician who works primarily by administering drugs, as opposed to surgeon 外科醫生|外科医生[wai4 ke1 yi1 sheng1]
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
the critical moment/life and death crisis
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
to transfer (a patient) to a different hospital/to transfer to hospital (e.g. a prisoner)
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
